isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - TWO SPEED AXLE SPEEDOMETER CIRCUIT - EXTENDED DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: EXTENDED DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para:
Refer to Figure 3.170 and 3.171
for the following discussion.

note.para: The purpose of this section is to diagnose the two speed interface with the speedometer. This section does not diagnose two speed axle operation.

svcproc.para: The vehicle speed sensor reads the revolutions of the transmission speedometer gear and sends a signal to the VPM. VPM programming includes the high and low rear axle ratios. The VPM uses the sensor input and rear axle rations to calculate the speedometer signal, depending on which range the vehicle is operating in. When voltage is applied to VPM terminal 9 from the two speed circuit, the VPM uses the low ratio.

The Two Speed Axle switch receives ACC power from 10A fuse F14. This is a normally open switch with "High" as the normal operating position. With the Two-Speed switch in the "Low" position, 12V accessory power is applied through VPM connector (381) at VPM terminal 9.
